lines.text: You're drunk!
And you're crazy. But I'll be sober tomorrow and you'll be crazy for the rest of your life.
Just use your own judgment.
You tell me where to go.

[muttering]
I'd like to tell you both where to go.
[Harold ripped a pillow playing with the dog]
Those were my mother's feathers!
Never knew your mother had feathers.
How old are you?
None of your business.
I'd say you were a man about 50.
You would say that.
[at breakfast, Norman takes the plate of bacon before Harold can get it]
Hey, put it down!
What's the matter, Pop? Don'tcha love me anymore?

[he raises his hand to hit Norman]
Certainly I love you.
Don't you strike that child!
Well, he's not gonna tell me I don't love him.
Do you know a man by the name of LaFong? Carl LaFong? Capital L, small a, Capital F, small o, small n, small g. LaFong. Carl LaFong.
No, I don't know Carl LaFong - capital L, small a, capital F, small o, small n, small g. And if I did know Carl LaFong, I wouldn't admit it!
[Harold has slipped on a skate]
Ha ha. Do it again, Pop.
Shut up!
Hurt yourself, Dear?
Shut... Umm no, Dear.
Oh, look what you've done!
She ran right in front of the car!
Why, it's a statue, you idiot. It's a Venus de Milo.
Seems pretty strange someone would call you from a maternity hospital in the middle of the night.
They didn't call me from a maternity hospital. They called thinking this was the maternity hospital.
Hey Pop, who ya think is dying?
Dying what?
Uncle Bean is dying!
Well you don't have to spit in my eye do ya?

[seeing Everett has stood by, allowing the toddler Elwood to open the spigot on the molasses barrel]
What did you let him turn the molasses on for?
I told him I wouldn't do it if I was him.
You told him you wouldn't do it if you was him. Get him outta here!
Why were you sitting there like a stone image when those men were insulting me?
I was just waiting for one of 'em to say something to me.
Wake up and go to sleep!
Ah, crackers. Good old crackers. That was a smart thing of me to bring those crackers along, wasn't it?
If you should live to be 100...
[Harold chases him off the deck]
And suppose I live to be 200, I'll get a velocipede!
This sun dial is ten minutes slow.
Yes, the sun is wrong but your watch is right, of course.
What do you have in the way of steaks?
Nothing in the way of steaks, I can get right to them.
How about my kumquats!
Coming. Coming. Coming. Coming. Coming.

[after being struck on the nose by a cluster of grapes dropped by Baby Dunk]
Shades of Bacchus!
Vegetable man? Vegetable gentleman?
Sufferin' sciatica!
Harold!
Don't argue with them, dear, they're beneath our dignity.
I never knew such an ungrateful father!
Listen, you've all got to realize one thing, that I am the Master of this house.

[Calling from another part of the house]
Harold!
Yes dear!

I don't know why it is that every time I want to talk to you, you're off in some other part of the house! I have to shout! Shout! Shout! No wonder the neighbors know all about our private affairs. I give them enough opportunity as it is to find out what's going on, without you running away as if I had the small pox or something. Every time I open my mouth...
[Harold slips out of the house]
I'll take two pounds of round steak.
Off the rump?
Yes.
Two round off the rump.
The only real money you'll ever have and you throw it away before you get your hands on a penny of it! What are you lying there for?
I'm tired.
Why don't you go to bed?
I thought I'd lie down and take a little nap first.
As I was saying - are you listening to me?
Eh, yes dear, yes dear, yes dear.
For twenty years, I've struggled to make a home for you and the children.
That's right dear.
Slaving day-in, day-out, to make both ends meet. Sometimes I don't know which way to turn.
Eh, turn over on your right side, dear. Sleeping on your left side's bad for the heart.
And no more drinking!
Oh, no, no, no. Good night, dear.
Dad, quick! Mother's fainted!
Huh? Oh, here, here. Give her some of this reviver.
[Mildred gives her Mother some of Harold's hooch]
Doesn't it taste good?

[Amelia's revived]
Oh, you're an old idiot. But, I can't help loving you.
Give her another drink.
